Replies.Reply: Fish disappear, darkness envelopes us.  Cold and lifeless where light has never penetrated...Five thousand feet, ten thousand.  Deeper, where only strange, self-illuminating echoniderms move eerily through the currents.  Then suddenly WE HEAR STATIC from RADIO TRANSMISSION.  THEN VOICES...
He don't need a readout, man, he needs help!
Fuck the suits, it's the people monitoring them.  It Doc had been there like he's supposed to it never would've happened!
Fuck the suits man...this place is going to kill us first.
The good doctor hasn't showed yet.
Uh, oh...I see where this is going...
Whooo!  Right on, Cobb!  Let's hear it for our shop Steward!
Hey, Bo...when're you going to be off that thing?  I want to find out tonight's NBA scores and check the weather.
Jameson?  Who're you trying to con?
Hey, Hazy!  We got a day off tomorrow, Kemosabi!  Let's get shit-faced!
Yeah?  How'd the kid hold up?
It wouldn't make any difference in there...He could be two feet away and on fire and she'd still not see him!
Hell, it's in Russian.  I can't read it...
Hey, Willie, I got one served up for you.
Honey, the company don't give a flying fuck about "whys," they just look at the numbers and the contract says if we miss our quota they only got to pay us half-pay for the entire month.
"Routine," my ass!  Ain't nothin' "routine" about no physical check-
Hey, man, we made quota to-
Oh, man, sorry...you go back to sleep.
Sleeping.  No sign of Doc, though.  I'll check the control room.  You look in the shower room...
Excuse me, sir...Bowman's sick.  She's downstairs in the infirmary.
Yes sir, ain't that where we usually go when we're sick?
Bullshit...I was just talking to him.  I saw him move.
We're getting out of here just in time.
Fuck double pay, man!  I want out of here!
Oh, Jesus Christ!  I ain't never gonna sleep again!
'Fucker could have gotten us all killed.
Hungry?  After what we just went through I may never eat again.
Relax, Cobb.  If it was going to turn, it would have done its trick by now.
Don't tell me you're getting soft on us, Cobbie?  You're the fellow who always said--
Probably the plumbing.  You gonna make me finish that puzzle by myself, or what?
Hazy, please...I'm going to get you some help, man...just don't touch me...
One of those chunks of Sixpack!  Like a big leech, with those teeth!...
What are you going to do to him?
I've got Cobbie downstairs watching the door.
That thing happens to be my friend.
I ought to smack your face!
Fucking great...You telling me we got a fucking dracula in here with us?
What dead one on the ship?
Someone want to let the rank and file in on your little secret?
And hit the surface in the middle of a typhoon?...No, thank you.
Well done.  Just like momma makes 'em.
The good doctor signed our death warrant.
Hey, man, you better get your ass out here right now and get us.  You hear me, motherfucker?  Right now!
There're twenty miles of pipe in the bilge, they could have tapped-in anywhere.
She's wondering what's happening.  We're losing air faster than I thought.
I am thinking, man!  You think I want to die!  I am thinking!  I--
I hit it.  But I can't see it!  Can you see it?!
How many times I got to tell you.  I saw a ship.
Jameson?  Who are you trying to con...?
Answer them and quit kicking me!
All right!  I've had enough of this shit!  You want meat, motherfucker?  Come on, eat me, sucker, try some dark meat!
What's wrong you snout-nosed bastards?  My meat too tough for you?!
Whoa!  Did you see those fools run?  They know whose boss.
Oh, gag, man, how can you eat that stuff?...
Hey, Hazy, I'm not that bad, man.
Oh, mother of Jesus, forgive me of my--
I know all about implosion, man.
You giving us a day off?
Hey, man, you know that in Switzerland--and this country's the size of East L.A., okay?--they speak 54 different dialects?
I do, man.  That's a beautiful place.  When I get out of here I'm going there.  Find a nice little snow covered chalet, warm little woman, crackling fire--
Hey, Cobb...Man, why don't you take off your shirt and pants, man?  You should do that wearing what you're going to wear at the beach.
No, man, Cobb is a Chivas drinker, from way back.  Ain't that right Cobbie?
What game, Cobb?...I'm on my way to Nirvana...
I'm on the way to the looney bin?  Hey, man, I'm not the dude sun bathing in his clothes.
That's it Jonesy...Sweat it out, man...Got to get the poison out of our blood.
Probably confiscated.  No booze on board, same as us.
That's all you do is exercise.
I poured the vodka in here.
Can you beat that?  The sonof-
Good work out there, Mr. Becky.
Serves his ass right to get it.  Motherfucker brings that shit onboard.  I hope his fucking ass rots in the sea and is shit upon by the fish.
You know that Innsbruck has 64 square miles of ski slopes, man?  Think about that.
What?  That?...I've done this one before.  You hungry?  I'm hungry.
Help me, Jonesy.  Oh, God, help me!  It's getting inside me, I can feel it!
I can't wait for fresh vegetables...
I'm telling you, it's the suits!
What's the weather like up top?
What was that?  What'd you say?
You got money in this tub?
That sounds interesting, but they're too tied to their holdings.  Remember a year ago when they lost that tanker?...
You're damn right I do.  Five years down here and I'll pull in more than 15 topside.  I'm not down here for the fun, I'll tell you that.
The weather's good, I already checked, but I'll be off in a minute.
Replies.Didascalie: (not taking her eyes off the screen, answers him)

Replies.Reply: Your "hangovers" made you miss the Sixpack Good Morning Show.
"No goddamn boy is going to make me go out on a down day."
If he had his blinkers on--
What would be dumb enough to eat Sixpack?
What about his suit?  That's a million five the company's got to replace.  They'll make somebody go get it.
Yeah, I'd say you can retire with all this loot.
Didn't I ever tell you vodka was my favorite drink?
Thirty days, right down the toilet...
Well, I must be human because I'm sure as hell sick.
ON WILLIE  She has stopped in her tracks.  All around her is blackness.  Her helmet light hardly penetrates the darkness.
ON WILLIE  She moves through the dense waving forest of giant tubers, parting them with her hands as she moves slowly.
ON WILLIE  She moves to the end of the hall.  It ends with two doors.
Lights move in the blackness, but there is an order to the actions and a crispness to the voices.  People doing work that is moving sharply.  Pride in what they're doing.
JONES' LEGS  His wet suit is now completely split open and WE SEE THE BLACK SCALES SPREADING!
Today...with DeJesus.  That was smart thinking to get him inside...
A little problem, sir...but I've got a handle on it now.
I signed-up for the stock option.
You take your money, too seriously, Bo.
Hey, Jonesy, who's the best power forward in the NBA...Jameson?
Sorry, darling...Just thought a little humor would loosen us all up...you know?...
We're fine, Shack.  His lights malfunctioned for a minute.  How's this?
You screw around like that again and--
He's gone.  I think he's fallen.  I'm going down after him.
No, thanks.  I've got my blood tests in three days.
After my astronaut training physical, then I'll tie one on.
After a month of it you'd think I'd be used to it.
Why?  You going to give me hard time like the others?
I need electrical field experience on my resume.
I guess there's not a lot of adventure in the Control Room.
Well, I always heard you don't "learn" leadership, you earn it.
How did you know they'd get into the vodka?
Maybe you're more one of us than you think...sir.
No...he's really sick.  I heard him last night.  The company will take that into consideration...
Must be bad.  Even sick Sixpack never missed a meal.
You don't think it was from going on that ship do you?
You guys sure weren't so holy when you were shooting that vodka...It could have been you.
What on earth's the matter with you?
You can't go out there alone.
Well, at least we're safe inside here.
When are you coming for us?
How much time does that give us?
You can't go out there, that's what they want.
You don't think I'm sitting in here, do you?
Don't spend all day down there.
"Off we go...into the wild blue yonder..."
Are you sure you saw something?
Well, why haven't they answered our flares?
Who's the best power forward in the NBA...Jameson?
It hit me!  Where are they?!
How about a burger and fries?
Halogen lights illuminate bits and pieces of dredges and dumpsters squatting in the gloom.  A winch begins grinding and the big, newly hooked container lurches down the tracks.
Knock it off, Sixpack!  I know it's been a long month for every-
Better let the Doc take a look at you, after dinner.
Leave the Doc to me.  I'm going to talk to him.
I've been looking at the duty roster...at the shack hours outstanding...
...all of you owe time and I thought tonight would be a good time to---
I know all about the contract.
You're only twenty-five tons off quota.  Barring an unforeseen problem you should reach it easily on the last day.
It's just a day off.  You don't have to take it, I just thought it might help.
Cobb, Jones, I want you to do something about that damn rattle in the air system...
Williams...get DeJesus' suit on the "sick rack" and do a diagnostics.
Any other suit problems she should know about?
There probably wasn't anything wrong with his suit...
Are you planning on working tomorrow?
We almost had an accident today.
I...I think it's important to have the second officer on deck.
Two hundred and fifty-two tons of Magnesium and 15 tons of Sodium.
This is Beck.  Is there a problem, Williams?
How do you know it was Williams?
All right, Sixpack, you and Williams are gonna pull water duty tomorrow--
At ease!  You both have a half day...Anymore shit and its a full one.
I need more light on that, Four.
That's great.  Now let's move 35 degrees southwest.
Why can't we pick up his signal?
Tighten the picture on the upper righthand corner.
Willie, we're giving you five minutes...after that we're coming in.
I want all this stuff impounded in the supply safe.
What do you want me to say?
Look, I think it's no big deal but if you want to find out why this ship sank have Maritime run a check.
This is a mining shack, not a lab, Doc.  If there's something strange with the vodka it's safe till we get back.
...Just let me put this in my safe...
That was a loud one wasn't it?
Whatever made you want to do a tour down here?
Everybody in corporate training serves a tour on the line.  Sup-
You think I should hang around more with the crew?
I guess I figured if I was in their shoes that's what I would've done.
How's the weather for pickup tomorrow?
No, he's really sick...He won't be going out today.
Is this a contract violation, Mr. Cobb?
Let's get it out of here and bring in a new one.
Dead?  This morning you said he had some skin disorder.
Well, how the hell does a skin rash kill you in eight hours?!
The mask is because you think it might be...catching?
What you don't understand is that my crew is in jeopardy.
I'm not anxious to find out, either.
What're you saying?  That we're not even going to be picked up tomorrow?
But it's a delay!  How long?
I can't tell you much about it, except that none of you show any symptoms.
There's now a problem with the weather for pickup.  There's a typhoon in our sector...

Replies.Didascalie: (motions for Jones to come with him)

Replies.Reply: I think we just found our problem.
Not exactly a big ocean country.
Well, if they were perfecting an aquaman, then why's there a dead one onboard that Russian ship?  Why isn't he out swimming around?
Shut up, both of you!  We've got to find it.
Jones...come with me.  Cobb, you and Doc check the rooms.
I thought they were your friends?
You fire that in here and you'll bring the whole place down.
That's why there's a dead one on the ship.  It ran out of blood.
That it acquires intelligence from its victims?
Our only chance is to lure it to the Swamp and flush it like we did the other.
Don't worry, I don't want to give up any more.
I hear something. Don't fire until we're both in the Swamp.
He's right.  Why don't you get some rest.  I'll stand the first watch.
Yeah...I think they're just deciding what to do with us.
I can't believe they'd just leave us.
Less than an hour.  It's ruptured an air duct.
Jones!  Get your feet out of the water!
I got hung up!  Try this!
We'll fire one more, that leaves us one last one.
I don't know yet, she's still in there.
Then what?  You folks think going up top's the answer to all your problems.  Well, it ain't.
A break?  You folks don't need a break, you need psychiatrists.  'Know what you'd be doing if you were up there, right now?
Eating pussy my ass.  What about lines at the bank:  What about getting stuck in traffic?

Bullshit!  I'll tell you what you'd be doing!  You'd be watching news on TV that's so fucking bad it makes you nauseous.  So you go out and get in your car to get some fresh air and after you've been driving for five minutes you realize the air's so damn dirty you don't dare breath it!  That's what you've got to look forward to...
No way, Mister Beck!  No fucking way!  We just did a full shift, you can't call Shack duty on top of a full shift.  It's a contract violation!
Ah, it's just old, like me.
You gonna sit there on your butt or give me a hand?
This is what I wear at the beach, goddamnit.
You guys are crazy.  What the hell you play that stupid game for?
You're on your way somewhere all right...the looney bin.
What music?  There ain't no music.
You know it's really crazy to pretend to be drunk, but it's fucking insane to pretend to have a hangover.
Pretty good.  He sent them out videotaping outcrop.
Weren't they tied?  They're supposed to be tied.
You're on your own, Sixpack, you fucked up everybody's day off...
What assholes, they lock booze in the safe.
Uh..Excuse me sir, it's the air recirculating system, sir...
...I'd really have to show it to you.
Hey what happens it he goes back and finds the bottle missing?
Bad as he is there's no way we can make our quota with-
No sir...I just wanted to know if you needed a hand?
He didn't say it was a "routine check-up," he said it was a "routine precaution."
Ain't the food or the air system, he's just sick...
Christ, it'd be a hell of a thing if I went back to the roof with some kind of herpes thing.  My wife wouldn't understand that at all...
At least we get time and a half.  That's in the contract.
Mr. Beck, the contract states that no body can be disposed of without authorization of---
I feel it, too...Someone's trying to get out.
It bit me!  It bit me!
That's easy for you to say.
I ain't doing nothing for that thing without something to defend myself.
I say we should go get in the escape bubbles and get the hell out of here!
And how're we going to do that?
And just what the fuck would he have done to stop it, huh?
That would have been you, DeJesus...

Yeah...I was standing next to a guy who blew a suit once in the Indian Ocean...little tiny hole in the fucking toe of his suit ...ocean came in and the pressure crammed his whole fucking body up into his helmet.
I bet you were imploding in your pants.
Yeah, since he was busy earlier when you needed him.
Hear that Becky, er, Mr. Beck?
My pocket.  Check my pocket, will ya, honey?
The latch is screwed up.  Or the hinge.
I said, "What a pair" the boy wonder Shack Boss and his drunken doctor buddy make...
Why?  What did ya think I said?
Hey, Willie, honey...Sorry about that little incident tonight...Everyone's been so tight lately, I thought a little humor'd loosen us all up, you know?
I got a date with an angel...
Oh, Darlin'...come sit on my face...
Look at my foot, sir!  This bitch put a goddamn sea monster in my bunk!
What's wrong, did you miss me?
It's all mine if I'm on report.
What good's the kid's med records anyway!
You guys are so full of shit...
Like I said, that bottle's mine!
Forget space cadet, I'll drink hers.
That little turd.  If I ever get the chance I'll fix his ass.
Well, it ain't!  It feels a thousand times worse.
Shit, Doc...I didn't know I had them.
The NOISE stops the fight between DeJesus and Sixpack cold.
Sixpack storms into the Mess with the dead Sea Spider.  He points angrily at his bleeding foot.  Jones and DeJesus move up to watch.
Jones is bench pressing 200 pounds on a fold-down compact gym, while DeJesus huffs and puffs on an exercise bike.
Beck approaches the Mess and as he nears it we hear Cobb ranting inside.
Snakebite medicine...Never pack my bag without it.
Well, I'll be on the golf course in the morning.  Then, if I don't have any babies to deliver--
You got something to say to me, son?...
I'll keep it to nine holes in the morning.
My God, look at the size of those tubers....
It's a log of some sort.
Russian, French, Italian, Spanish, Greek, German, a little Hindu, some Serbo Croat and a smattering of Swahili...standard pre-med background...
You mind if I take a look at this?
See that gash?  The way the edges protrude inward is like from a torpedo explosion.  It couldn't have come from within.
I did.  They have no record of the wreck.
The Marshal Goloviev is now on a tour in the Baltic Sea.
I want your permission to check that vodka.
Pretty good imitation of a hangover and I ought to know.
How long...how long have you had these?
I'm just going to take a tiny piece of skin to look at under the microscope...Afterwards I'll give you a sedative.
No kidding?  "A virus of unknown origin."  Come on and tell me something I don't know...
Here.  Put this on.  You examine him.
For this...you don't need to be.
I don't know.  I've been back and forth with Narragansett Naval all day, consulting with the best people in maritime medicine, the best people in viruses...
And they didn't believe the symptoms I described...
It could be a million things, something in the air, food....
But he went on that ship and so did Williams...
Replies.Didascalie: (he looks up and locks eyes with Beck)

Replies.Reply: I want to examine the crew.
I've reported the death to the company.
Not yet.  You got any ideas?
That's a possibility.  But if it was that simple why haven't the symptoms begun on you?
You have to call them back.
We're simply concerned about her...proximity to...
Bowman.  It's Doc.  I'm here to help you.
No.  I think they isolated him in genetic engineering.
Danakil man?...one of our ancestors.  Named for the Danakil Alps in Ethiopia.
It was when it counted a couple of million years ago when the seas came in and drove us into the water.  Most homo sapiens didn't make it...Danakil man...
Some say that's why we're basically hairless, for less water resistance, faster swimming speeds...
Why stop with just one aspect of marine life?  Why not incorporate the best genetic components the ocean has to offer?...
He obviously lacked something in his environment.
We've got to get him to the infirmary.
I'm going to try to remove it.
The monster appears to be a genetic aberration...
...It has many traits of deep sea marine life...regeneration, scales, gills, even a period of dormancy...
but the fact that it remembered where the plasma was stored, or where the communication wiring was, may imply that it has some other quality...
Intelligence may not be the right word...
Take it off and let me have a look.
Looks good to me.  I'll re-bandage it, though.
Willie, would you clean it for me.  I'm going to the infirmary for supplies.
I'm the Doctor.  I have to do what's best for this crew.
There, good as new.  Just keep your paws off of it.
Do you have the new bandage ready?
Sounds like a good week, Beck.
You're good executive timber, Beck.  A lot of management trainees wash out when they have to go under for their first tour.  But you've done well.
Don't thank me, yet, but it is important to know where you're going and who your friends are...
The one thing I've learned in this company is you can't have enough friends.  It's the only way to survive.
...as long as you know it's not in your contract.
Well, suit yourself, then...its your decision...

Replies.Didascalie: (looking at a report, then up at Beck)

Replies.Reply: Well, according to Maritime law, you, as commander of the Shack have the authority to dispose of the body.  However, the company doesn't want you to do that.
But you don't have any proof at this point to assume that this disease is contagious, do you?
Beck, trust me.  If the company felt that you or your crew were in any danger we would authorize an immediate emergency pickup.
There is a typhoon about 600 miles off the coast of Baja.
It shouldn't be a long delay.
Twelve hours, no big deal.  We should know something first thing in the morning.  Don't worry.
I realize you must have gone through hell--
Beck!  I told them you'd make it.  No one back at TransOcean believed me, but I never gave up on you once.

Willie watches the Sea Spider move in the water toward her as Beck's words come over the P.A.  Ignoring Beck she watches the spider right as it moves to her feet then brings the soldering iron down into the water with a LOUD HISS skewering it.  She presses the intercom button and lifts the skewered sea spider out of the water.
Willie enters and checks her running time on her watch.  She bends over to catch her breath then straightens suddenly.
They enter the quiet Swamp.  The suits hang silently like sleeping monsters.  Beck steps into the equipment room.
ON COBB  He lies on his bunk under a sunlamp, but wears a T-shirt and long pants.  DeJesus does a jigsaw puzzle of a snow covered Swiss mountain scene.
Jones enters the Dorm with his snack and tosses a can of Coke across the room to DeJesus.

SIXPACK'S BUNK  He closes his privacy door and hesitates as if listening for the others, then he removes a silver flask with Cyrillic lettering--the silver object he palmed in the Swamp--and smiles as he takes a long pull.  Suddenly WHAM!
ON COBB  Standing watch for DeJesus.  Suddenly the door to the Control room opens and Beck walks out.  Cobb grabs a walkie-talkie.
Doc pours some bourbon in a glass, and takes a sip.  Beck enters dazed from the sick room and their eyes meet.
Pale skin, fishbelly white with white hairs, seen closely...
She wouldn't understand.  She'd think I was down here fucking my head off.
But he ain't dead!  He ain't dead.
Beck leads the way slowly toward the Infirmary where the sound is coming from.  Outside the door they hear it once more.  THUMP!
From somewhere in the darkness we hear the HISSING SOUND OF ESCAPING OXYGEN and the FAMILIAR RATTLE OF THE AIR SYSTEM.

ON BECK  He moves around a corner we recognize from before with Jones' and Cobb's repair.  Beck floods the area with light and the break in the line is visible.  The pipe has been torn from the wall, it is totally unreparable.  What's worse, electrical wires hang down, showering sparks into the water.

Characters.Character: IN A BLINDING FLASH OF ELECTRICITY

Replies.Reply: instantly rigid.  A second later it crashes forward into the water.
FALLING CEILING BEAMS CRASH DOWN IN FRONT AND BEHIND...
I thought you said you'd combed this area?

Replies.Didascalie: (looks at Martin then to a Lieutenant)

Replies.Reply: Mr. Beck, I understand you passed your physical with flying colors.  And Ms. Williams?
Well, you'll be glad to know you have a friend onboard.
I thought we might have some wonderful seafood.  But, if there's something else you'd rather have...
